LSCC Breakfast
Health Innovations Task Force Meeting
sessions.description: NCSL’s Task Force on Innovations in State Health Systems explores the issues and opportunities faced by state policymakers as they reform their own health system. The task force will discuss the role of AI in health care and members and sponsors will participate in an interactive site visit in the afternoon. Contact [email protected] for more information.

sessions.title: LSCC Artificial Intelligence Special Work Group
LSCC Professional Staff Association Officers Work Group

Election SATs: Security, Accuracy and Transparency
sessions.description: If you’re a leader on elections policy, this precon is for you. Join with peers from throughout the nation to share the latest on accuracy, security and access to the ballot. We will have sessions on cybersecurity, primaries, funding, cast vote records, campaign finance, election consolidation and post-election audits. For registration information, please go to: https://www.ncsl.org/events/details/election-sats-security-accuracy-and-transparency

NCSL Foundation Board Meeting
sessions.description: Learn about the NCSL Foundation at the Board of Directors Meeting. The board will approve the Foundation's budget, awards to NCSL and more. All Foundation sponsors are welcome. Lunch will be provided.

Welcome! It's Time to Conquer the Summit
sessions.description: First Legislative Summit? Or maybe it's been a while since you've attended? Join this orientation to learn how to make the most of the meeting, and hear all about NCSL. The Boston Town Crier will offer a slice of Massachusetts colonial history. Stay after the presentations to network with colleagues at a light reception.

sessions.title: Executive Committee Reception
sessions.description: Celebrate NCSL's global connections with international attendees and partners immediately following the executive committee meeting.

The room provides a peaceful space with reduced lighting, comfortable seating including bean bag chairs, and optional quiet activities, such as coloring and word searches. To preserve the atmosphere, we kindly ask that all visitors refrain from conversations, phone use or other disruptive behavior.

sessions.description: Get registered! Bring your photo ID to a kiosk and print your Summit badge, which you’ll need for all NCSL events. Pick up a tote bag and Summit magazine, and say hello to our friendly staff—we’re always happy to help!

sessions.title: Legislative Staff Nominating Committee Meeting
Legislator Nominating Committee Meeting
Mothers' Room
sessions.description: A mothers' lounge with soft seating, outlets and a mini fridge is located in Room 158. Additionally there is a more private Mamava nursing pod located in the foyer just outside Room 158.

sessions.title: State Meet and Greets
sessions.description: Join your NCSL state liaison for coffee before the General Session.

sessions.title: Fun Run Check-In
sessions.description: Pick up your bib for the Fun Run during registration. Whether you run or walk, it's sure to be a morning of fitness and camaraderie! Registration is limited to 500 participants, and you must be registered for the Legislative Summit to register for the Fun Run.

sessions.title: Opening General Session: Getting From Division to Dialogue in State Capitals

speakers.name: Michael Smerconish
speakers.title: Host of "The Michael Smerconish Program" on SiriusXM
speakers.organization: Host of CNN's "Smerconish", Newspaper Columnist and Best-Selling Author

sessions.description: The attacks on Minnesota legislators and their families continue a trend of political violence that has targeted lawmakers in both parties. Coarsened political discourse has contributed to a culture of distrust and cynicism. Join national experts and legislative leaders to explore what lawmakers, legislative staff and others can do to turn down the temperature and restore civility in the public square.

sessions.title: 1975: The Birth of NCSL

speakers.name: Natalie Wood
speakers.title: Vice President of Policy and Research

sessions.description: Fifty years ago, there were three competing organizations of state legislators and staff. After five years of negotiations, three became one—the National Conference of State Legislatures. Join us to hear stories about NCSL’s early years from those who were there.

sessions.title: Agency Oversight: Getting It Right
sessions.description: States have assessed government effectiveness for decades via legislative oversight. This year, the creation of the federal Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) sparked a renewed emphasis in some states. Join us to learn new and improved ways state legislatures are holding agencies accountable, ensuring state programs are operating as intended.

sessions.title: How to Use NCSL's 50-State Bill Info Service and Databases
sessions.description: No matter what bill you're looking for, NCSL and partner LexisNexis State Net have got you covered! Come learn about this powerful research tool, along with how to utilize NCSL's 50-state legislative databases.

sessions.title: Law and Public Safety Standing Committee Business Meeting
sessions.description: Join the discussion as we develop the NCSL policy positions used to advocate before Congress and the administration. Only legislator members can vote, but everyone can add their state's voice. Snacks will be provided.

sessions.title: Meetings and Readings and Customs, Oh My!

speakers.name: Heshani Wijemanne
speakers.title: Chief Assistant Secretary of the Senate

sessions.description: The 2030 Mason's Manual Commission takes you on a tour of recent cases about parliamentary procedure, featuring open meetings, third reading requirements, custom, usage and precedent.

sessions.title: Navigating the Now: Key Trends in Health Policy
sessions.description: Stay ahead of the curve with a dynamic discussion on the latest health policy trends and priorities shaping the future of care. Come explore key legislative developments from statehouses nationwide, insights into the policy implications of the new administration's priorities, and other emerging health policy topics.

sessions.title: Refresh for Results: Getting the Vote Quicker
sessions.description: When it comes to elections, an accurate ballot count is paramount—but speed matters, too. What policy choices lead to quicker unofficial results reporting? Join us to learn more about some of these options, then chat with peers in other states about how they get things done.

sessions.title: Revolutionizing the Future: The Impact of Robotics and AI

speakers.name: Nicol Turner Lee
speakers.title: Senior Fellow and Director
speakers.organization: Center for Technology Innovation, Brookings Institution

sessions.description: The integration of robotics and AI is revolutionizing how we learn, work and create. Join us to explore how responsible technological development is empowering individuals, driving economic growth and fostering innovation

sessions.title: Secrets From Journalists: How to Write Anything Better
sessions.description: Ever wonder how to make your writing less cluttered and more compelling? Join a former Associated Press national writer and a panel of experts to gather some surefire tips and tricks to help you engage legislators, colleagues and constituents through the written word.

sessions.title: Tariffs: The Impact at Home and Abroad

speakers.name: Claudio Irigoyen
speakers.title: Managing Director and Head of Global Economics Research

sessions.description: Tariffs affect both the federal trade balance and the economies of individual states, which play an active role in international trade by engaging in commerce, attracting investments, and developing policies that increase competitiveness. Discover how world trade dynamics are evolving and the impact on states of an increasingly complex global market.

sessions.title: The Brave New World of College Athletics

speakers.name: Tim Buckley
speakers.title: Senior Vice President for External Affairs

sessions.description: A landmark court settlement allows athletic programs to share revenue with student-athletes, bringing a host of new issues to the playing field. Come hear about the terms and viability of the settlement, and the role that states and the federal government might play in this new era.

sessions.title: The Mingle Project: Michael Smerconish’s Plan to Bring Us Back Together

speakers.name: Michael Smerconish
speakers.title: Host of "The Michael Smerconish Program" on SiriusXM
speakers.organization: Host of CNN's "Smerconish", Newspaper Columnist and Best-Selling Author

sessions.title: The Road Out of the Red: Smart Strategies for Transportation Infrastructure
sessions.description: Billions of dollars are spent annually by local and state governments on roads, bridges, transit and other transportation assets. Learn how states can adequately measure and track maintenance and investment needs for public infrastructure and explore policy tools to wisely allocate revenue to tackle infrastructure shortfalls.

sessions.title: For Legislators Only: Democratic Lunch Featuring JB Pritzker
sessions.description: Join your Democratic colleagues for lunch featuring Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker. This lunch is for Democratic legislators only.

sessions.title: For Legislators Only: Republican Lunch Featuring Chris LaCivita

speakers.name: Chris LaCivita
speakers.title: Co-Campaign Manager for Donald Trump’s 2024 Campaign

sessions.description: Join your GOP colleagues for lunch featuring President Trump’s 2024 co-campaign manager, Chris LaCivita. This lunch is for Republican legislators only.

sessions.title: Lawn on D Lunch
sessions.description: Everyone’s invited to a luscious lunch outdoors at the Lawn on D—a delicious way to kick off a great week at Summit!

sessions.title: Notable Document Awards Ceremony and Lunch

speakers.name: Ingrid Hernquist
speakers.title: Manager
speakers.organization: OLS Library Services, New Jersey Legislature

sessions.description: Each year, the Legislative Research Librarians professional staff association sponsors the competition for outstanding state and legislative documents that explore topics of interest to legislators and legislative staff, present substantive material in an outstanding format and showcase the wide range of legislative information available. Join us to honor the winners during the NDA award ceremony and lunch. Presented by the Legislative Research Librarians Professional Staff Association.

sessions.title: Steering Committee
sessions.description: Officers from each standing committee will review policy directives and resolutions for consideration.

sessions.title: A Capitol Conversation: Preserving a Legislative Legacy

speakers.name: Andrea Aggertt
speakers.title: Director
speakers.organization: Office of the Architect of the Capitol, State of Illinois

sessions.description: Come learn more about the history of state capitol buildings and the complex work to renovate and renew these architectural marvels. Hear about the yearslong photographic journey behind NCSL’s new book—"Capitol Views"—which captures every U.S. legislative building in 240 pages of stunning images.

sessions.title: Beyond the Reactor: State Roles in the Nuclear Cycle

speakers.name: James Holloway
speakers.title: Vice President
speakers.organization: Nuclear Engineering and Fleet Support, Dominion Energy, Inc.

sessions.description: Join us for a deep dive into state involvement with the nuclear fuel cycle. Come hear experts explain the process of the nuclear cycle, including mining, fuel fabrication, reactor manufacturing, transportation, and spent-fuel storage and processing, along with state policy implications.

sessions.title: Education Standing Committee Business Meeting
sessions.description: Join the discussion as we develop the NCSL policy positions used to advocate before Congress and the administration. Only legislator members can vote, but everyone can add their state's voice. Snacks will be provided.

sessions.title: Elections and Redistricting Standing Committee Business Meeting
sessions.description: Join the discussion as we develop the NCSL policy positions used to advocate before Congress and the administration. Only legislator members can vote, but everyone can add their state's voice. Snacks will be provided.

sessions.title: From Coins to Code: Shaping the Future of Cryptocurrency

speakers.name: Jacob Hamilton
speakers.title: Interim Regulatory Innovation Officer
speakers.organization: Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation

speakers.name: Sabrina Bergen
speakers.title: Chief of Staff for Policy and Supervision

sessions.description: As cryptocurrency continues to disrupt financial systems, state governments are stepping up with new legislation, commissions and innovative approaches to regulation. Come explore how states are navigating the complexities of crypto policy, balancing state and federal roles and fostering economic opportunities while ensuring consumer protection.

sessions.title: How to Have Hard Conversations
sessions.description: In a world of polarization and profound disagreement, how can you engage effectively during difficult talks? Join us to learn three tools for how to communicate better with a colleague, your boss or the guy next door—even when it's tough.

sessions.title: Rock and a Hard Place: Navigating Medicaid Budgets

speakers.name: April Kees
speakers.title: Staff Director
speakers.organization: Virginia Senate Finance and Appropriations Committee

sessions.description: When it comes to Medicaid, states face competing budget pressures, dwindling revenues and an uncertain federal funding environment. Join us to discuss how states are deciding on priorities, finding creative solutions and considering tough choices to achieve balanced budgets while improving health outcomes for their constituents.

sessions.title: Safer States: Shoring Up the Public Safety Workforce
sessions.description: It can be tough to attract enough employees for high-stress, high-risk professions such as law enforcement and corrections. Learn how states are thinking creatively to overcome shortages and promote the safety and well-being of current employees and the communities they serve.

sessions.title: State of Emergency: Bracing for Extreme Weather Costs

speakers.name: Kristiane Huber
speakers.title: Officer
speakers.organization: U.S. Conservation, The Pew Charitable Trusts

speakers.name: Peter Muller
speakers.title: Senior Officer
speakers.organization: Managing Fiscal Risks, The Pew Charitable Trusts

sessions.description: Given the barrage of extreme weather events and shifts in federal funds, what can policymakers do to reduce the long-term impacts and costs? Planning and budgeting are critical mechanisms to mitigate the consequences of extreme weather. Discover what steps states can take today to get ahead of tomorrow's natural disasters.

sessions.title: The Civics Education Game
sessions.description: If you never knew how fun civics education could be, it's time to find out! Join contestants from three state civics programs as they vie for the attention of "Citizen X" with questions about how the process works and ways they can get involved.

sessions.title: The Road to Surface Transportation Funding

speakers.name: Susan Howard
speakers.title: Director of Policy and Government Relations
speakers.organization: American Association of State Highway and Transportation Officials

speakers.name: Connor Torossian
speakers.title: Deputy Assistant Secretary for Intergovernmental Affairs

sessions.description: As conversations on Capitol Hill ramp up for a new federal transportation bill, come take a deep dive into the status of IIJA programs and the highway trust fund—and the innovative steps states are taking to boost revenue.

sessions.title: Walking the Tightrope: AI's Risks and Rewards
sessions.description: The potential of artificial intelligence to transform our daily lives is quickly becoming reality. Come learn about the latest AI developments and their potential impact on businesses and governments. Hear from state legislators across the country about the challenges of mitigating AI's risks while unleashing its potential for innovation.

sessions.title: A Debate on Tariffs, Free Markets and the Future of U.S. Trade Policy
sessions.description: Join us for a debate on the effect of U.S. trade strategies on the states, including job creation, economic competitiveness, supply chains and state-level industries. Prepare for a lively and focused discussion that promises to engage and challenge you and provide new insights into U.S. trade policy.

sessions.title: AI Use Inside the Legislature: What's the Latest?
sessions.description: As the use of generative artificial intelligence becomes the norm, legislatures are creating policies to help staff get the most out of these high-tech tools. Join us for the scoop on how state legislatures are managing AI use for legislative work and what kinds of guardrails are improving the safety of this evolving technology.

sessions.title: Boosting the Base: State Support for the Military
sessions.description: Military operations at installations contribute billions of dollars each year to state economies. State policies and funding help sustain military installations to retain jobs and preserve economic benefit. Learn how states are providing and leveraging funds for base infrastructure needs and encouraging land uses compatible with the military mission.

sessions.title: Civility: The Secret Legislative Sauce
sessions.description: Can civility really improve your legislative processes? Join a panel of legislators and staff for insights into the evolution of legislative civility, efforts to make it part of the culture and what the results have been. Learn more about why a civil legislature is an effective one.

sessions.title: Family First at 5: Progress, Pitfalls and Paths Forward

speakers.name: David Hansell
speakers.title: Senior Advisor for Child Welfare Policy

sessions.description: How has the Family First Prevention Services Act changed child welfare systems after five years? Come hear experts and legislators share their insights and experiences, and leave with actionable strategies to strengthen policies that prevent child maltreatment and promote child and family well-being.

sessions.title: Health Standing Committee Business Meeting

speakers.name: Chris Jones
speakers.title: Senior Advisor to the CMS Administrator
speakers.organization: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services

sessions.description: Join the discussion as we develop the NCSL policy positions used to advocate before Congress and the administration. Only legislator members can vote, but everyone can add their state's voice. Snacks will be provided.

sessions.title: Looking Back, Moving Forward: Legislative Staffing Patterns

speakers.name: Peverill Squire
speakers.title: Professor
speakers.organization: University of Missouri, Truman School of Government and Public Affairs

speakers.name: W. Stuart Loosemore
speakers.title: Esq.
speakers.organization: Manager of Talent and Engagement, Massachusetts General Court

sessions.description: Join a discussion about the evolution of legislative staffing levels, locations and roles over the last 50 years. Hear from a state legislative expert and legislative staff about the impact of changes in staffing patterns, district offices and interim work on the legislative process. Come ready to share what's happening in your state.

sessions.title: Mastering the 3 R's: Bipartisan Strategies to Improve State Education Systems

speakers.name: Katy Anthes
speakers.title: Director
speakers.organization: Forward Initiative and Former CO Commissioner of Education, Public Education & Business Coalition

speakers.name: Jared Solomon
speakers.title: Deputy Speaker Pro Tempore of the House

sessions.description: Students still struggle in the basics of reading, writing and math, especially since the pandemic. Hear from an expert about the most recent data. A bipartisan group of legislators will discuss the consequences of lower math and reading skills for this generation’s students and discuss bipartisan solutions to improving student outcomes.

sessions.title: Natural Resources, Energy and Environment Standing Committee Business Meeting
sessions.description: Join the discussion as we develop the NCSL policy positions used to advocate before Congress and the administration. Only legislator members can vote, but everyone can add their state's voice. Snacks will be provided.

sessions.title: State Budgets 2025: Time to Tighten the Belt?
sessions.description: After several years of strong tax collections and state spending, state revenue growth shows signs of slowing down. What does this mean for state budgets? Learn about the state budget outlook from a leading analyst with S&P Ratings along with the results of NCSL's latest budget survey.

sessions.title: Stop the Scam: Foiling Financial Fraud

speakers.name: Christopher W. Kelly
speakers.title: Director
speakers.organization: Digital Evidence Laboratory, Office of the Massachusetts Attorney General

speakers.name: John Breyault
speakers.title: Vice President
speakers.organization: Public Policy, Telecom & Fraud, National Consumers League

sessions.description: Financial frauds and scams cost consumers more than $10 billion a year and pose an escalating threat to Americans' public safety and financial well-being. Come hear experts share federal, state and private sector strategies for reducing fraud, protecting consumers and exposing and prosecuting those responsible.

sessions.title: Foreign Influence in State Politics
sessions.description: Foreign-owned corporations and lobbyists working for foreign principals who want to contribute to U.S. campaigns, buy political ads or lobby state governments must comply with special federal and state laws. Come learn about different approaches to regulating foreign involvement in state politics and see how your state compares.

sessions.title: Legislative Staff University: Finding an Extra Hour every Day: Time Management Tips and Tricks for Busy Professionals

speakers.name: Randy Dean
speakers.title: Randy Dean
speakers.organization: MBA, “The E-mail Sanity Expert”®, Speaker Exchange

sessions.description: In this popular program on “finding an extra hour” every day, Randy Dean, “The E-mail Sanity Expert”®, uses humor and high energy as he covers many of the most common areas of productivity loss afflicting many busy professionals: e-mail and input overload, managing multiple projects/tasks, unexpected interruptions, mental and physical “clutter”, and better managing your time, people, and projects. This includes specific strategies for Microsoft and Google users so they can apply these strategies to the software they use every day. helping stressed performers find extra time, leading to (hopefully!) an extra hour of productivity and focus every day.

sessions.title: Preparing Students for the Workforce

speakers.name: Jason Dougal
speakers.title: President and COO
speakers.organization: National Center on Education and the Economy

sessions.description: Many states are redesigning their educational experiences to ensure a more student-centered approach and that students develop workforce skills and gain credentials that lead to economic success. Hear from experts leading this work and policymakers working on implementation.

sessions.title: Putting the Brakes on Speed Demons

speakers.name: Jessica Cicchino
speakers.title: Senior Vice President
speakers.organization: Behavior and Infrastructure Research, Insurance Institute for Highway Safety

sessions.description: Habitual super-speeders—those who regularly go more than 25 mph over the limit—are more prevalent than ever on American roadways, and more than 12,000 deaths occur each year in speeding-related traffic crashes. Learn how states can harness enforcement, technology and infrastructure strategies to curtail speeding and protect other road users.

sessions.title: Taking the Lead: Women in Power
sessions.description: Nearly 100 women served as speaker of the House, president of the Senate, speaker pro tempore, Senate president pro tempore, majority leader or minority leader during the 2025 legislative session. Do women lead differently? Join women leaders and researcher Hannah Riley Bowles, co-director of Harvard Kennedy School's Women and Public Policy Program, to separate fact from fiction.

sessions.title: The ABCs of THCs: The Cannabinoid Conundrum

speakers.name: Michael Bronstein
speakers.title: Co-Founder and President
speakers.organization: American Trade Association for Cannabis and Hemp

speakers.name: Staci Gruber
speakers.title: Director
speakers.organization: Marijuana Investigations for Neuroscientific Discovery (MIND), McLean Hospital

sessions.description: Cannabis products for medical and adult use and hemp-derived products are found in nearly all states, confusing the public and legislators alike. The 2018 Farm Bill may have unintentionally created a gray area. Hear from medical experts, policy researchers and regulators about how these products differ from a consumer and policy standpoint, and state actions to regulate them.

sessions.title: The Tech Effect: What It Does to Kids

speakers.name: Elizabeth Burke Bryant
speakers.title: Professor of the Practice of Health Services

speakers.name: Kate Charlet
speakers.title: Director
speakers.organization: Privacy, Safety and Security Center of Excellence, Google

speakers.name: Zachary Rausch
speakers.title: Chief Researcher to Social Psychologist Jonathan Haidt

sessions.description: Young people are more digitally connected than ever before, with smartphones, tablets, computers, digital apps and social media a big part of their daily lives. But what are the long-term effects? Hear perspectives from experts across sectors on how technology and social media are affecting youth.

sessions.title: The Weakest Links: Strengthening Cybersecurity for the Energy Supply Chain
sessions.description: With threats growing across the energy supply chain, join us to discuss cybersecurity measures that utilities and energy producers can take. Learn more about how state legislatures can work with the energy sector to protect their systems. This session is not open to the media.

sessions.title: Unpack Your First Term: A New Legislators' Roundtable
sessions.description: Congratulations on making it through your first year! Now that the dust has settled, what did you think? What did you learn? Join other new lawmakers for an informal discussion to share your successes, challenges and surprises. NCSL is here to support you as you look ahead to the next session, so bring your questions!

sessions.title: What the Reconciliation Bill Means for States

speakers.name: Molly Ramsdell
speakers.title: Vice President of State Federal Affairs

sessions.description: Join us for fast-paced, information-packed updates from Washington, D.C. Gain a deeper understanding of how recent federal policies and decisions on Medicaid, SNAP, education and more are shaping the landscape in your state.

sessions.title: Where History Draws a Crowd
sessions.description: Boston, New Orleans, Philadelphia— these cities are known for their historic buildings and attract thousands of tourists annually. State tax incentives have played a significant role in keeping these buildings and their history from crumbling away. Speaker/s from a historic preservation society will discuss the role state tax incentives play in preserving American history.

sessions.title: Kick Off the Celebration on Canal Street
sessions.description: Just a block from TD Garden, Canal Street comes alive with vibrant street parties whenever Boston sports teams make the playoffs. Before heading to the Opening Reception at TD Garden, join us on Canal Street for a lively celebration of NCSL's 50th anniversary. This exciting event promises to set the perfect tone for an unforgettable evening.

sessions.title: Opening Celebration at TD Garden
sessions.description: Don’t miss your shot! Help us kick off the NCSL Legislative Summit at TD Garden, home to the legendary Boston Celtics and Boston Bruins. Join us to mix and mingle with food, beverages and music.

sessions.title: Fun Run
sessions.description: Join our race ambassador, Olympian Meb Keflezighi, for a 5K run/walk at the beautiful Castle Island on Aug. 5. Enjoy scenic waterfront views, connect with colleagues and jump-start your day with an energizing experience!

sessions.title: National Association of Jewish Legislators Annual Breakfast
sessions.description: Join NAJL for our annual breakfast at Summit! The National Association of Jewish Legislators (NAJL) brings together Jewish elected officials from across the country to build a strong network for sharing policy ideas, addressing common concerns, exploring opportunities, and fostering meaningful connections

sessions.title: Census Conversation
sessions.description: Join an informal conversation with the U.S. Census Bureau to learn about preparations for the 2030 census, including the status of the 2030 Redistricting Data Program, the upcoming Block Boundary Suggestion Project and implementation of the new statistical guidance on race and ethnicity.

sessions.title: Prayer Breakfast
sessions.description: All attendees are welcome to hear an inspirational message at the prayer breakfast as they participate in a time of bipartisan fellowship.

sessions.title: Meditation Room
sessions.description: A quiet/reflection room, located in Room 260, is available to attendees who need a break from the bustle of the conference. The room provides a peaceful space with reduced lighting, comfortable seating including bean bag chairs, and optional quiet activities, such as coloring and word searches. To preserve the atmosphere, we kindly ask that all visitors refrain from conversations, phone use or other disruptive behavior.

sessions.title: Mothers' Room
sessions.description: A mothers' lounge with soft seating, outlets and a mini fridge is located in Room 158. Additionally there is a more private Mamava nursing pod located in the foyer just outside Room 158.

sessions.title: North Registration
sessions.description: Get registered! Bring your photo ID to a kiosk and print your Summit badge, which you’ll need for all NCSL events. Pick up a tote bag and Summit magazine, and say hello to our friendly staff—we’re always happy to help!

sessions.title: General Session: The Great Political Realignment: The New Trump Coalition and the Coming Elections

speakers.name: Amy Walter
speakers.title: publisher and editor-in-chief
speakers.organization: The Cook Political Report With Amy Walter

sessions.description: Who makes up the Trump coalition? Are younger voters and voters of color moving right? If so, what’s in store for 2026 and 2028? Join renowned political analyst Amy Walter as she walks us through an exclusive look at the latest data from the 2024 election and reads the tea leaves for the midterms.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Open
Grand Opening: Time to Hit the Hall
sessions.description: There’s something for everyone in the Exhibit Hall! The opening reception will include light bites and coffee, as well as music from Proper Bostonian, a four-person band playing hit songs from famous Boston acts; watercolor caricature artists painting quick portraits or scenic Boston prints; and Colonial characters such as Paul Revere and a town crier roaming the hall. Be sure to check out the great mix of nonprofits, government associations, educational institutions, and public and private companies. Don’t miss the coffee lounges, Exhibit Hall Learning Hub sessions and Launchpad pavilion highlighting emerging businesses and new exhibitors! Sponsored by Dell Technologies and Nvidia.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | Celebrating 50 Years of Cutting-Edge Cures and Policy Progress
sessions.description: Join us to learn more about ground-breaking U.S. biopharmaceutical innovations, the positive impact for patients globally and the policies that can nurture and protect them for generations to come. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | Exposed Data, Real-World Risk: Why Privacy Is a Public Safety Issue
sessions.description: Bad actors exploit publicly available personal information to harass, impersonate or physically target individuals, including government employees and constituents. Learn how this information is exposed and why state leaders should view privacy protection as an urgent public safety issue. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | Demystifying AI in Medical Devices
sessions.description: Artificial intelligence is rapidly transforming patient care, from earlier disease detection to improving complex procedures. But how can state legislatures wrap their arms around it without hampering innovation? Understand the role of AI in medtech now, how we got here, and how it’s shaping the future of U.S. health care. sessions.title: Massachusetts Night
sessions.description: Join us pier-side for this exclusive event at the historic Charlestown Navy Yard, beside the USS Constitution, the world’s oldest commissioned naval warship still afloat. Enjoy a summer evening with historical reenactments, a fife and drum presentation, and great food and drinks on Boston Harbor. Please note: Shuttles will run from BCEC to the USS Constitution from 5-6 p.m. Shuttles will not run between hotels and the USS Constitution. Return shuttles will not be available. Board the USS Constitution | 5:30-8:30 p.m. Board the world’s oldest commissioned warship still afloat, a rare chance to step onto a piece of living history from the War of 1812. Nicknamed "Old Ironsides" for its strong oak hull that repelled British cannon fire, the ship now serves as an active-duty Navy vessel, stationed at the Charlestown Navy Yard in Boston. The experience brings to life over 200 years of naval heritage while offering stunning views of Boston Harbor. A tour not to be missed! Board the Cassin Young at the Charlestown Navy Yard | 5:30-7:30 p.m. The USS Cassin Young (DD-793) is a Fletcher-class destroyer of the U.S. Navy named for Captain Cassin Young (1894-1942) who was awarded the Medal of Honor for his heroism at the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and killed in the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal in the fall of 1942. The destroyer was launched Sept. 12, 1943, and was designated a National Historic Landmark in 1986 as one of only four surviving Fletcher-class destroyers still afloat. In addition to the tour, a representative from the National Park Service Engagement with National Park Service rangers will talk about the history of the National Park.

speakers.title: Senior Drinking Water / Water Quality Expert (PFAS)

sessions.description: Recent regulation changes for PFAS have raised new issues and concerns for state and local governments about public communication and education, liability, monitoring and clean up. Join us for a deep dive into how states are managing PFAS water contamination, and what’s in store for future PFAS regulation, mitigation and funding.

sessions.title: Unlocking Blockchain: Government and the Digital Transformation
sessions.description: Come explore the potential of blockchain technology in the public sector. How are state and local governments experimenting with blockchain to increase transparency, improve public services, and create secure, efficient systems? Experts will unpack real-world use cases where blockchain is already making a difference.

sessions.title: Who You Gonna Call? Coordinating Crisis Response Systems

speakers.name: Jim Lake
speakers.title: Director
speakers.organization: Charleston County Consolidated Emergency Communications Center

sessions.description: Since its launch in 2022, the 988 lifeline has received more than 10 million contacts from those dealing with a mental health crisis. Join us to discuss how such crisis response systems—including 911, EMS, law enforcement and mobile crisis teams—integrate complex traffic safety, behavioral health and emergency response systems to provide crisis care.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | Meeting the Energy Demand
sessions.description: Join Dominion Energy’s senior vice president of corporate affairs, Bill Murray, for a conversation on the current dynamic energy landscape, and how the company plans to meet the growing demand for power. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | Stop Synthetics and Keep Kratom Consumers Safe in Your State
sessions.description: Join the nearly two dozen states that have already acted to protect consumers with the Kratom Consumer Protection Act. Don’t let your state fall behind—learn how this commonsense legislation sets clear standards and preserves access for informed adults. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Ballot Measures as Barometers

speakers.name: Kate Hogan
speakers.title: Speaker Pro Tempore of the House

speakers.name: Peverill Squire
speakers.title: Professor
speakers.organization: University of Missouri, Truman School of Government and Public Affairs

sessions.description: Join state legislators and state legislative expert Peverill Squire for a discussion about the ways ballot measures reflect the public's attitude toward legislative institutions. Squire's research of more than 1,500 ballot propositions on legislative organization tells the story of public opinion toward legislatures over time—and a panel of legislators consider what it means for lawmakers today.

sessions.title: Building Resilience, Feeling Safe: A Guide for Women Legislators
sessions.description: Dr. Aparna Ghosh reveals what women legislators need to feel safe. Learn practical strategies and innovative solutions for navigating both digital and in-person challenges. Leave empowered with actionable tools to strengthen your resilience.

sessions.title: Carbon Capture: What's Next?

speakers.name: Patrice Lahlum
speakers.title: Vice President
speakers.organization: Industrial Innovation & Carbon Management, Great Plains Institute

sessions.description: Join us to explore the expanding role of carbon capture in the United States, even as the current administration prioritizes fossil fuel production. Experts will highlight the commercial readiness of carbon capture technologies, their potential role in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, and market forces impacting advancement and deployment.

sessions.title: Leading in an Infinite Game
sessions.description: Too often, our leadership mindsets are fixed within the world of finite competitions—beating our foes in the next game, or the next election. But the legislative world is actually an infinite game, with rules and objectives that require a new model of leadership. Come explore how a shift to an infinite mindset can enhance your ability to lead your chamber on a course for long-term success.

sessions.title: Let Me Run This by My Attorney First
sessions.description: Learn how clear communication, mutual respect and collaboration between your team's communications and legal experts can help navigate sensitive issues, mitigate risks and achieve your legislature's goals. Whether drafting a press release, managing a crisis or responding to media inquiries, discover practical strategies to build a stronger, more cohesive partnership.

sessions.title: Navigating Uncertainty: Global Approaches to Trade and Economic Cooperation

speakers.name: Jeevan Ramapriya
speakers.title: Executive Director
speakers.organization: Massachusetts Office of International Trade and Investment

sessions.description: As global economic uncertainty challenges trade and economic stability, this session offers a unique opportunity to explore how representatives from Canada, the European Union, and Massachusetts are addressing these issues. Through a combination of brief, insightful presentations and collaborative group activities, attendees will dive into the trade strategies, challenges, and opportunities shaping global partnerships. Following opening remarks from each speaker, participants will work in small groups to tackle real-world trade challenges, brainstorm actionable solutions, and explore opportunities for deeper collaboration between U.S. states and international partners. Groups will then share their findings in a facilitated debrief, with speakers reflecting on the proposed solutions and providing additional insights.

sessions.title: PL8S 101: Why License Plates Really Matter

speakers.name: Marcy Coleman
speakers.title: Vehicle Program Manager
speakers.organization: American Association of Motor Vehicle Administrators

sessions.description: From missing persons and car theft to traffic enforcement and tolling, license plates and new camera technology help ensure public safety. Learn how states are using these tools and addressing new concerns.

sessions.title: Spotlight on Education in Massachusetts

speakers.name: Paul Reville
speakers.title: Francis Keppel Professor of Practice of Educational Policy and Administration

speakers.name: Pedro Martinez
speakers.title: Commissioner
speakers.organization: MA Dept of Elementary and Secondary Education

sessions.description: Massachusetts has long been regarded as having among the best education systems in the world. Come learn about the policies and practices in place to achieve such success and how the state plans to address the challenges that lie ahead.

sessions.title: The Evolving Overdose Crisis: Strategies and Solutions

speakers.name: Allison Arwady
speakers.title: Director
speakers.organization: National Center for Injury Prevention and Control, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

speakers.name: Matthew Rohrbach
speakers.title: Speaker Pro Tempore of the House

sessions.description: Drug overdose deaths have surged fivefold in the last 25 years, claiming over a million U.S. lives. But in in 2023, overdose deaths fell for the first time in five years. Join experts and state legislative leaders as they reflect on the policies that might be fueling this turnaround and explore policy options to meet the challenges moving forward.

sessions.title: What the Latest Federal Tech Action​ Means for States
sessions.description: Join us for a quick update on the latest federal developments in technology-related legislation focused on emerging issues such as artificial intelligence, privacy, cybersecurity, fintech and broadband. Gain an understanding of how federal tech policy is shaping the future and what actions states can take to stay ahead of the curve.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | A Smarter Path for Food Safety Regulation
sessions.description: Join the Food Ingredient Safety Coalition (FISC) in a session exploring why food safety should remain a federal responsibility. Presenters will outline how a consistent, science-based system protects consumers, avoids costly state patchworks, and ensures access to safe, affordable food nationwide, including in schools. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | From Red Tape to Real Opportunity: Regulatory Reform
sessions.description: State and local occupational licensing disproportionately affects women, who are more likely to work in licensed occupations and less likely to have the time and resources to satisfy licensing requirements. This panel explores the impact of regulations that burden women entrepreneurs and ways state legislators can reduce regulatory barriers. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | Focus on Rare Patient Access
sessions.description: Rare disease patients often navigate years of misdiagnosis, but the lucky ones find care and therapies that improve their lives. Learn more about challenges faced by rare patients and innovative solutions to lower patient out-of-pocket costs and improve access to therapies. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | Patients as Partners in Policymaking
sessions.description: Health policy is complex, but what really matters is how policies impact patients’ access, affordability and quality of care. Join us to learn about the depth and breadth of the patient community, how to effectively engage and partner with patients, and what policy areas matter the most to patients. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Lunch
sessions.description: Enjoy a delicious lunch with your colleagues and visit exhibitors from around the nation with unique information and a wide range of policy perspectives.

sessions.title: Legislative Staff Lunch: Locked In: The Bold Create the Future
Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | Applied AI Today: Improving Safety and Efficiency
sessions.description: Governments work to boost services, protect workers and improve road safety—all while operating efficiently. Join us to learn more about how AI-powered technologies can empower frontline workers with data-driven insights and unlock gains in safety and government efficiency. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Exhibit Hall Learning Hub | Integrating Digital Advocacy with Direct Lobbying to Influence Policy Outcomes
sessions.description: Working on legislation in your state that could grow or cripple your organization? Discover strategies to integrate your direct lobbying efforts with the latest grassroots advocacy technology to boost advocate engagement, influence lawmakers and their staff, acquire new supporters at scale, streamline legislative outreach, and track campaign effectiveness.

sessions.title: NCSL Business Meeting
sessions.description: Make your state’s voice heard. All legislators and legislative staff are encouraged to attend the annual NCSL Business Meeting, which will consider policy directives and resolutions that will guide NCSL's advocacy efforts before Congress and the administration, elect NCSL officers and Executive Committee members, consider amendments to NCSL's Bylaws and Rules of Procedures, and approve the NCSL budget. All Summit attendees are welcome to observe. Parliamentarians: Tom Bottern, Secretary of the Minnesota Senate and Jennifer Novack, Secretary of the Idaho Senate.

sessions.title: Closing General Session: The Room Where It Happens: Leslie Odom, Jr. on Unlocking Your True Potential

speakers.name: John Snyder
speakers.title: NCSL Staff Chair
speakers.organization: Committee Staff Administrator, Kentucky General Assembly

sessions.description: You’re going to want to be in the room where it happens—the Legislative Summit’s closing general session where Tony and Grammy award winner Leslie Odom, Jr. will perform and inspire. On the eve of reprising his iconic role of Aaron Burr on Broadway, Odom will bring his life lessons on following your passions, discovering your own potential, and surrounding yourself with the right people. And he just might perform a few of his iconic songs, too. Don’t throw away your shot—join us for this spectacular closing general session.

sessions.title: Closing Reception at Leader Bank Pavilion
sessions.description: Wrap up the NCSL Legislative Summit at Leader Bank Pavilion on Boston Harbor with a performance by the iconic Boston Pops and legendary R&B group Boyz II Men. Enjoy an evening under a tent with food, drinks and live music, along with an unforgettable view of Boston Harbor at sunset. This is an event you won’t want to miss! Please note there will be a fireworks display following the concert. Presented by Live Nation.
